title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Submit issue Issues page

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo Github account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/taxizedb.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version taxizedb ropensci/taxizedb) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/taxizedb.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch) Push account Submit pull request home base ropensci/taxizedb

title: taxizedb

title: taxizedb
text: Several mapping functions available NCBI taxonomy database:
code: # Map scientific or common names to taxonomy IDs name2taxid("pig") #> [1] "9823"  # Map taxonomy IDs to scientific names taxid2name(9823) #> [1] "Sus scrofa"  # Map taxonomy IDs to rank taxid2rank(2) #> [1] "superkingdom"

what: Tools for Working with Taxonomic Databases
title: Tools for Working with Taxonomic Databases
text: taxizedb - Tools Working Taxonomic Databases machine Docs: https://docs.ropensci.org/taxizedb/ taxize heavily used taxonomic toolbelt package R - However, makes web requests nearly methods. fine cases, user many, many names much efficient requests local SQL database.

title: Tools for Working with Taxonomic Databases
text: taxonomic databases publicly available, possible mash SQLized version. Taxonomic DB’s supported: NCBI: text files provided NCBI, stitch sqlite db ITIS: provide sqlite dump, use PlantList: created stitching together csv files. source longer updated far can tell. say ’ve moved focus World Flora Online Catalogue Life: created Darwin Core Archive dump. GBIF: created Darwin Core Archive dump. right now taxonomy table (called gbif), add tables darwin core archive later Wikidata: aggregated taxonomy Open Tree Life, GLoBI Wikidata. Zenodo, created Joritt Poelen GLOBI. World Flora Online: http://www.worldfloraonline.org/ Update schedule databases: NCBI: since db_download_ncbi creates database function called, ’s updated whenever run function ITIS: since ITIS provides sqlite database download, can delete old file run db_download_itis get new dump; think update dumps every month PlantList: longer updated, shouldn’t need download first download. hosted Amazon S3 Catalogue Life: GitHub Actions job runs day 00:00 UTC, building lastest COL data SQLite database thats hosted Amazon S3 GBIF: GitHub Actions job runs day 00:00 UTC, building lastest GBIF data SQLite database thats hosted Amazon S3 Wikidata: last updated April 6, 2018. Scripts available update data prefer . World Flora Online: since db_download_wfo creates database function called, ’s updated whenever run function Links: NCBI: ftp://ftp.ncbi.nih.gov/pub/taxonomy/ ITIS: https://www.itis.gov/downloads/index.html PlantList - http://www.theplantlist.org/ latest monthly edition via https://www.catalogueoflife.org/data/download GBIF: http://rs.gbif.org/datasets/backbone/ Wikidata: https://zenodo.org/record/1213477 World Flora Online: http://www.worldfloraonline.org/ Get touch issues ideas new data sources. databases SQLite.

title: Tools for Working with Taxonomic Databases
text: package data sources performs following tasks: Downloaded taxonomic databases db_download_* Create dplyr SQL backend via dbplyr::src_dbi - src_* Query get data back data.frame - sql_collect Manage cached database files - tdb_cache Retrieve immediate descendents taxon - children Retrieve taxonomic hierarchies local database - classification Retrieve taxa descending vector taxa - downstream Convert species names taxon IDs - name2taxid Convert taxon IDs species names - taxid2name Convert taxon IDs ranks - taxid2rank can use src connections dplyr, etc. operations downstream. use database connection raw SQL queries.

what: Retrieve all taxa descending from a vector of taxa — downstream
title: Retrieve all taxa descending from a vector of taxa — downstream
text: function nearly equivalent taxize::downstream() function

code: downstream(x, db = "ncbi", verbose = TRUE, ...)

title: Retrieve all taxa descending from a vector of taxa — downstream
text: x (character) Vector taxon keys given database db (character) database search, one ncbi, itis, gbif, col, wfo verbose (logical) Print verbose messages ... Additional arguments passed database specific downstream functions

title: Retrieve all taxa descending from a vector of taxa — downstream
text: list data.frames columns: childtaxa_id, childtaxa_name, rank. exactly equivalent output taxize::downstream()

title: Retrieve all taxa descending from a vector of taxa — downstream
code: if (FALSE) { # get descendents from all ranks # downstream(c(3700, 9605)) # takes a while  # limit results to species downstream(c(3700, 9605), downto='species')  # allow ambiguous nodes but no ambiguous species downstream(   c(3700, 9605),   downto='species',   ambiguous_nodes=FALSE,   ambiguous_species=TRUE )  # ITIS id <- name2taxid('Aves', db = "itis") downstream(id, db = "itis", downto = "family") downstream(id, db = "itis", downto = "genus") id <- name2taxid('Bombus', db = "itis") downstream(id, db = "itis", downto = "species")  # COL id <- name2taxid('Chordata', db = "col") downstream(id, db = "col", downto = "family")  # GBIF id <- name2taxid('Pinaceae', db = "gbif") downstream(id, db = "gbif", downto = "genus")  # World Flora Online id <- name2taxid('Pinaceae', db = "wfo") downstream(id, db = "wfo", downto = "species") }

what: Convert species names to taxon IDs — name2taxid
title: Convert species names to taxon IDs — name2taxid
text: name2taxid() returns vector dies ambiguous names. name2taxid_map() returns data.frame mapping names ids

title: Convert species names to taxon IDs — name2taxid
code: name2taxid(x, db = "ncbi", verbose = TRUE, out_type = c("uid", "summary"), ...)

title: Convert species names to taxon IDs — name2taxid
text: x (character) Vector taxon keys given database db (character) database search, one ncbi, itis, gbif, wfo, tpl verbose (logical) Print verbose messages out_type (logical) character "uid" ID vector, "summary" table columns 'tax_id' 'tax_name'. ... Additional arguments passed database specific classification functions.

title: Convert species names to taxon IDs — name2taxid
text: NCBI taxonomy database includes common names, synonyms misspellings. However, database little inconsistent. species, Arabidopsis thaliana, misspelling Arabidopsis_thaliana included, done humans. However, underscores supported querying entrez, done taxize, implies entrez replacing underscores spaces. . corner case appears organism uses underscores part name, just standin space ("haloarchaeon 3A1_DGR"). deal case, replace underscores spaces spaces original name.

title: Convert species names to taxon IDs — name2taxid
code: if (FALSE) { name2taxid(c('Arabidopsis thaliana', 'pig')) name2taxid(c('Arabidopsis thaliana', 'pig'), out_type="summary") name2taxid(x=c('Arabidopsis thaliana', 'Apis mellifera'), db = "itis") name2taxid(x=c('Arabidopsis thaliana', 'Apis mellifera'), db = "itis",  out_type="summary") name2taxid(x=c('Arabidopsis thaliana', 'Quercus kelloggii'), db = "wfo") name2taxid(x=c('Arabidopsis thaliana', 'Quercus kelloggii'), db = "wfo",  out_type="summary") name2taxid("Austrobaileyaceae", db = "wfo") name2taxid("Quercus kelloggii", db = "gbif") name2taxid(c("Quercus", "Fabaceae", "Animalia"), db = "gbif") name2taxid(c("Abies", "Pinales", "Tracheophyta"), db = "col") name2taxid(c("Abies mangifica", "Acanthopale aethiogermanica",   "Acanthopale albosetulosa"), db = "tpl") }

code: taxa_at(   x,   rank,   db = "ncbi",   missing = "lower",   verbose = TRUE,   warn = TRUE,   ... )

title: Get taxa at specific scientific ranks — taxa_at
text: x (character) Vector taxon keys (ids) given database. required rank (character) target rank fetch data. required db (character) database search, one ncbi, itis, gbif, col, wfo missing (character) data found given rank input key, get next closest lower given rank, higher. one lower (default), higher. verbose (logical) Print verbose messages warn (logical) TRUE, raise warning taxon IDs can found ... Additional arguments passed database specific classification functions

title: Get taxa at specific scientific ranks — taxa_at
text: list data.frame's input taxon key, data.frame fields: name, rank, id. results found, empty data.frame

title: Get taxa at specific scientific ranks — taxa_at
code: if (FALSE) { taxa_at(186803, rank = "order", db="ncbi", missing = "lower") taxa_at(c(186803, 541000, 216572, 186804, 31979,  186806),  rank = "family", missing = "lower") taxa_at(c(154395, 154357, 23041, 154396), rank = "family", db="itis") taxa_at(c('wfo-4000032377', 'wfo-0000541830'), rank = "family", db="wfo") taxa_at("wfo-7000000057", rank = "order", db="wfo") taxa_at(2877951, rank = "phylum", db="gbif") taxa_at(c(2877951, 5386), rank = "family", db="gbif") taxa_at(c(3960765, 3953606, 3953010), rank = "family", db="col") }

taxizedb — taxizedb-package
text: Taxonomic databases interface

what: Supported data sources and database structure
title: taxizedb — taxizedb-package
text: using SQLite database NCBI: text files provided NCBI, stitch sqlite db ITIS: provide sqlite dump, use PlantList: created stitching together csv files. source longer updated far can tell. say moved focus World Flora Online Catalogue Life: created Darwin Core Archive dump. Using latest monthly edition via http://www.catalogueoflife.org/DCA_Export/archive.php GBIF: created Darwin Core Archive dump. right now taxonomy table (called gbif), add tables darwin core archive later Wikidata: aggregated taxonomy Open Tree Life, GLoBI Wikidata. Zenodo, created Joritt Poelen GLOBI. World Flora Online: http://www.worldfloraonline.org/

title: taxizedb — taxizedb-package
text: NCBI: since db_download_ncbi creates database function called, updated whenever run function ITIS: since ITIS provides sqlite database download, can delete old file run db_download_itis get new dump; think update dumps every month PlantList: longer updated, need download first download Catalogue Life: GitHub Actions job runs day 00:00 UTC, building lastest COL data SQLite database thats hosted Amazon S3 GBIF: GitHub Actions job runs day 00:00 UTC, building lastest COL data SQLite database thats hosted Amazon S3 Wikidata: last updated April 6, 2018. Scripts available update data prefer . World Flora Online: since db_download_wfo creates database function called, updated whenever run function

title: taxizedb — taxizedb-package
text: NCBI: ftp://ftp.ncbi.nih.gov/pub/taxonomy/ ITIS: https://www.itis.gov/downloads/index.html PlantList - http://www.theplantlist.org/ Catalogue Life: via http://www.catalogueoflife.org/content/annual-checklist-archive GBIF: http://rs.gbif.org/datasets/backbone/ Wikidata: https://zenodo.org/record/1213477 World Flora Online: http://www.worldfloraonline.org/

title: taxizedb — taxizedb-package
code: if (FALSE) { library(dplyr)  # data source: NCBI db_download_ncbi() src <- src_ncbi() df <- tbl(src, "names") filter(df, name_class == "scientific name")  # data source: ITIS ## download ITIS database db_download_itis() ## connect to the ITIS database src <- src_itis() ## use SQL syntax sql_collect(src, "select * from hierarchy limit 5") ### or pipe the src to sql_collect src %>% sql_collect("select * from hierarchy limit 5") ## use dplyr verbs src %>%   tbl("hierarchy") %>%   filter(ChildrenCount > 1000) ## or create tbl object for repeated use hiers <- src %>% tbl("hierarchy") hiers %>% select(TSN, level)  # data source: The PlantList ## download tpl datababase db_download_tpl() ## connecto the tpl database src <- src_tpl() ## do queries tpl <- tbl(src, "tpl") filter(tpl, Family == "Pinaceae")  # data source: Catalogue of Life ## download col datababase db_download_col() ## connec to the col database src <- src_col() ## do queries names <- tbl(src, "taxa") select(names, taxonID, scientificName)  # data source: GBIF ## download gbif datababase db_download_gbif() ## connecto the gbif database src <- src_gbif() ## do queries df <- tbl(src, "gbif") select(df, taxonID, scientificName)  # data source: Wikidata db_download_wikidata() src <- src_wikidata() df <- tbl(src, "wikidata") filter(df, rank_id == "Q7432")  # data source: World Flora Online db_download_wfo() src <- src_wfo() df <- tbl(src, "wfo") filter(df, taxonID == "wfo-0000000010") }

title: Caching — tdb_cache
text: Manage cached taxizedb files hoardr

title: Caching — tdb_cache
text: cache_delete accepts 1 file name, cache_delete_all accept names, deletes files. deleting many specific files, use cache_delete lapply() type call

title: Caching — tdb_cache
text: tdb_cache$cache_path_get() get cache path tdb_cache$cache_path_set() set cache path tdb_cache$list() returns character vector full path file names tdb_cache$files() returns file objects metadata tdb_cache$details() returns files details tdb_cache$delete() delete specific files tdb_cache$delete_all() delete files, returns nothing

title: Caching — tdb_cache
code: if (FALSE) { tdb_cache  # list files in cache tdb_cache$list()  # delete certain database files # tdb_cache$delete("file path") # tdb_cache$list()  # delete all files in cache # tdb_cache$delete_all() # tdb_cache$list() }

title: taxizedb 0.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2023-04-03 New maintainer (#65).

title: taxizedb 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-01-15

title: taxizedb 0.3.0
text: db_download() gains new parameter overwrite (logical): used state want overwrite existing database disk. manually delete older database file (#34) new function added taxa_at() getting taxa specific scientific ranks. example, known taxon family Lachnospiraceae NCBI identifier 186803. want information phylum Lachnospiraceae family . function can . (#51)

title: taxizedb 0.3.0
text: fixed problem internal function txdb_rr(): older verions R (e.g., 3.6) creating data.frame function without settings stringsAsFactors=FALSE, resulting different behavior R v3 vs. R v4 given change stringsAsFactors behavior R v4 onward (#54)

title: taxizedb 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-08-26

title: taxizedb 0.2.2
text: fix failing tests (#50)

title: taxizedb 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-08-13

title: taxizedb 0.2.0
text: gains 3 new data sources: NCBI taxonomy, World Flora Online, Wikidata (#18) (#49) (#37) gains ports taxize functions taxizedb (NCBI & ITIS supported): children, classification, downstream. beware taxize taxizedb loaded R session namespace calls three functions (#19) (#25) (#44) (#48) gains mapping functions: name2taxid (scientific common name taxonomy ID); taxid2name (taxonomy ID scientific name); taxid2rank (taxonomy ID rank) (#41) (#42) intro vignette added (#17) GBIF COL data sources updated daily repos https://github.com/ropenscilabs/gbif-backbone-sql https://github.com/ropenscilabs/col-sql/ via GithHub Actions. See repos details (#26) update package level manual file (?taxizedb-package) details data source, update schedules, examples data sources now use SQLite database storage engine. passwords/ports/usernames/etc longer needed! note db_download* functions download already created SQLite databases, whereas data sources database built locally machine data formats downloaded (see also #36, #46) copy taxonomic ranks information taxize package ported internal use able make downstream() work data sources

title: taxizedb 0.2.0
text: remove check whether SQLite installed (#5 #29) src_* functions now two paramters: path .... path default figures path using function db_path(), ... allows user pass parameters DBI::dbConnect

title: taxizedb 0.2.0
text: db_load() now defunct. Now just use db_download* src* data source (see also #43)
